revised_title: Determination of Differential Conductance Coefficients in a Cation-Exchange Membrane
tldr: The authors developed an experimental procedure to determine the six independent conductance coefficients controlling ion and solvent fluxes in a cation-exchange membrane. They measured volume and salt fluxes under pressure gradients and calculated non-equilibrium thermodynamic conductance coefficients. The results showed that the coefficients are strong functions of solution concentration, which affects the use of integral flux equations in small concentration intervals across the membrane.
